** The Property Casualty Insurers Association of America (PCI) is hosting more than 85 CEOs and senior executives from property casualty insurance companies around the country this week as part of our Legislative Action Day and Board of Governors meeting.

Top issues include urging support and passing the Protecting Automotive Repair, Trade, and Sales (PARTS) Act of 2015 (H.R.1057 and S.560) to preserve competition in the collision repair parts industry, the Policyholder Protection Act (H.R.1478 and S.798) to ensure federal banking regulators cannot inappropriately use assets intended to protect insurance consumers to bail out other financial firms, and S.1086 and H.R.2141 to preserve the U.S. system of state-based insurance regulation by requiring more transparency, accountability, and focus on U.S. consumers before committing to global insurance standards.

Spotted at the event were: Mark Bryant, Resonate; Leland Vittert, Fox News; Marie Formica, FamousDC; Morgan Gress, 1776; Stephanie Fontenot, Sen. Roy Blunt’s office ; Matt Haller, IFA; Gerrit Lansing, RNC; Archie Smart, Qorvis; Bryant Avondoglio, Speaker John Boehner’s office ; Carol Danko, SIFMA; David Almacy, Edelman; Mike Lurie, Freedom Partners; Shana Glickfield, Beekeeper Group; and Amos Snead, Bryant Row.

Hosts and guests included: Priya Dayananda of KPMG, U.S. Court of Appeals Judge Sri Srinivasan, Neil Chatterjee from Majority Leader Mitch McConnell’s office, Kapil Sharma of Wipro, Neal Patel from Sen. Dean Heller’s office, Anurag Varma of Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld, Saat Alety from Rep. Ed Royce’s office, Nisha Jain of Purple Strategies and Moh Sharma from Rep. Xavier Becerra’s office.

** PCI CEO’s are in Washington this week fighting to preserve competition in the collision repair parts industry, protect insurance assets from being used in bank resolutions, and encourage appropriate implementation of the Dodd-Frank Act recognizing the successful U.S. state insurance system and resisting international pressure that weaken its consumer focus.
